citation.article-title: Devosia albogilva sp. nov. and Devosia crocina sp. nov., isolated from a hexachlorocyclohexane dump site.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Devosia albogilva sp. nov.
Devosia albogilva (al.bo.gil′va. L. fem. adj. albogilva whitish yellow).
Cells are Gram-negative, aerobic, rod-shaped, non-spore-forming and motile with a single polar flagellum.
Colonies are cream in colour and circular with entire margins (0.5–2.0 mm in size) when grown on LB agar plates for 3 days.
Grows well on LB agar and NA, but less growth is seen on TSA.
Temperature, pH and NaCl concentration ranges for growth are 5–45 °C, 5–9 and 0–3 %, respectively.
Assimilates l-arabinose, galactose, glucose, lactose, fructose, d-mannitol, mannose, xylose, maltose and sucrose, but not myo-inositol.
Cells are positive for oxidase, catalase, urease and β-galactosidase activities and aesculin hydrolysis.
Negative for DNase, lipase and nitrate reductase activities.
Does not hydrolyse casein, gelatin or starch.
Does not utilize citrate or produce indole.
Sensitive to ciprofloxacin, gentamicin, chloramphenicol, rifampicin, amikacin, ampicillin, vancomycin and tetracycline; resistant to polymyxin B and kanamycin.
Major cellular fatty acids are iso-C15 : 0, summed feature 8 and 11-methyl C18 : 1ω7c.
The type strain is IPL15T (=CCM 7427T=MTCC 8594T), isolated from an HCH dump site in India.
